column1: Molecules are categorized into different classes by considering their structures.

column4: and SM13 due to the common N-phenylquinazolin-4-amine group.

column2: and SM07 due to the common 4-(benzylamino)quinazoline group.
and SM15 due to the common 1-phenyl-1H-benzoimidazole group.

column1: For each class a substructure search has been carried out  with ZINC15 database and the following pattern has emerged:
Class I-15 substructures ; Class II-14 substructures; Class III-12 substructures
Class IV-6 substructures; Class V-7 substructures; Class VI -12 substructures
The LogP data of  the SMX molecules in each class and their similar substructures are collected based on ZINC15 database.The same set of molecules have been optimized with B3LYP/6-31G+.
The descriptors considered are the following:
The most negative atomic partial charge in the molecule based on NBO (q-NBO
The most positive atomic partial charge on a hydrogen atom based on NBO (qH+NBO
The most negative atomic partial charge in molecule based on Mulliken (q-Mulliken
The most positive atomic partial charge on a hydrogen atom based on Mulliken (qH+Mulliken
These molecular descriptors are used to generate  a multiple linear regression by using the best model in XLSTAT
column2: an Excel plug-in. The molecular descriptors of the substructures of each class have been used to obtain the QSPR equation:

column1: The molecular descriptors of each SMX molecule are inserted in the QSPR equation to obtain predicted  LogP values
column2: these latter values have been reported.

column1: The differences between the predicted and actual LogPZINC15 values are used for calculating the standard error of the mean (SEM) and the root mean square error (RMSE) values.
For the calculation of standard error of the mean (SEM)
column2: the standard deviations (?) have been calculated by using Equation 1.

column1: The standard error of mean (SEM) values have been calculated by using Equation 2.

column2: the root mean square errors (RMSE) have been used as model uncertainity based on Equation 3 where Pi  is the value of LogPZINC15 for each molecule
column3: Oi is the LogPCalculated and n is the number substructures considered for each data set.
